SASReport.label: 4171-2020: Vertically Scrolling Dashboard Templates for VA 8.2

P.Span: Buffer boxes, found directly below this text, are placed under section headers to help give more space to objects below. A buffer box is created by adding a single character to a default text box and changing its color to the background color.

P.Span: This header is inside a Standard Container with 16 padding.

The Journal template adds buffer space to the left-and-right hand side of the screen. A text box with a white character is set to a 10.5% width on the left side of the screen. All other objects are set to a width of 80%, giving 9.5% white space to the right side of the screen. The text box on the left causes all graphs to shrink. As a result, object height must be manually set, and Shrink height if necessary must be unchecked.

P.Span: The Static Title template places a header at the top of the report that does not move. This is helpful for creating dynamic text that indicates which filters are selected, such as a location, product, or other single-selection filter.
This object and all other objects are enclosed in a standard scrolling container.
SAS Global Forum paper 4171-2020: Make Beautiful Vertically Scrolling Dashboards in SAS Visual Analytics

The Simple Template uses default settings for all objects. Simply drag and drop new objects above, below, and next to each other to create a vertically scrolling dashboard. The default settings will help ensure that the dashboard maintains high compatibility across multiple devices and screen resolutions.
Widths and heights can be adjusted as needed. To increase scrolling space for desktop users, decrease the width of all objects by 2%.
SAS Global Forum paper 4171-2020: Make Beautiful Vertically Scrolling Dashboards in SAS Visual Analytics

The Side Filter template capitalizes on horizontal screen space, moving page controls from the top of the page to the side using a scrolling container with a width of 20%. The container to the left forces all objects to shrink. As a result, object height must be manually set, and Shrink height if necessary must be unchecked.
SAS Global Forum paper 4171-2020: Make Beautiful Vertically Scrolling Dashboards in SAS Visual Analytics

MediaScheme.name: ms1
